meanings.definition: In a safe or protected manner.
meanings.sent1: She tied the knot securely to keep the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent2: The valuable documents were stored securely in the safe.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel securely held onto the tree branch during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird nested securely in the sturdy tree, protecting her eggs.
meanings.sent5: The knight guarded the castle gate securely, ensuring no intruders could enter.

meanings.definition: In a way that is firmly fixed or fastened.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter hammered the nails securely into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The gate was securely locked to prevent unauthorized entry.
meanings.sent3: The cat securely wrapped its tail around the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree were securely anchored in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent5: The rope was securely tied to the post, holding the tent in place.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is certain or guaranteed.
meanings.sent1: She double-checked the address to ensure the package would arrive securely.
meanings.sent2: The insurance policy securely protected the family in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The student securely knew the answer to the math problem.
meanings.sent4: The lock securely confirmed that the door was properly closed.
meanings.sent5: The contract securely guaranteed the delivery of the goods on time.
